title: Combination of resistors to dissipate energy

content.question: Which of the following combinations of 4 ùõÄ resistors would dissipate 24 W when connected to a 12 V battery?

choices.label: Choice A is a circuit diagram with zigzag lines representing resistors. Choice A has two resistors along a vertical wire.

Choice B is a circuit diagram with zigzag lines representing resistors. Choice B starts with a vertical wire at the bottom and then has a junction with one wire going to the left, one to the right, and one straight up. Each of these wires has a resistor. The three wires then come back together after the resistors at another junction and end with one vertical wire at the top.

Choice C is a circuit diagram with zigzag lines representing resistors. Choice C starts with a vertical wire at the bottom and then has a junction with one wire going to the left and one to the right. The left wire has one resistor and the right wire has two resistors, one after the other. The two wires then come back together after the resistors at another junction and end with one vertical wire at the top.
Choice D is a circuit diagram with zigzag lines representing resistors. Choice D has three resistors along a vertical wire.

Choice E is a circuit diagram with zigzag lines representing resistors. Choice E starts with a vertical wire at the bottom and then has a junction with one wire going to the left and one to the right. Each wire has one resistor. The two wires then come back together after the resistors at another junction and there one vertical wire at the top. There is a third resistor on this top vertical wire.

content.answer: Choice E is a circuit diagram with zigzag lines representing resistors. Choice E starts with a vertical wire at the bottom and then has a junction with one wire going to the left and one to the right. Each wire has one resistor. The two wires then come back together after the resistors at another junction and there one vertical wire at the top. There is a third resistor on this top vertical wire.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
